citation.article-title: Endozoicomonas elysicola gen. nov., sp. nov., a gamma-proteobacterium isolated from the sea slug Elysia ornata.

p.s: Description of E. elysicola sp. nov.
L. n. elysia, Elysia, name of zoological genus; L. suff. cola, dweller; N.
In addition to the properties given in the genus description, the colonies on marine agar are 4–5 mm in diameter after 3–5 days incubation at 25 °C.
No growth occurs at temperatures above 37 °C or below 4 °C.
Hydrolysis of esculin is observed, and hydrolysis of gelatin is not observed.
β-Galactosidase, urease, acetoin, H2S, and indole are not produced.
Utilization of citrate is not observed.
Acids are produced from the following compounds: glucose, galactose, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, maltose, and gluconate.
Acids are not produced from the following compounds: arginine, ornithine, arabinose, ribose, rhamnose, mannose, mannitol, sorbitol, lactose, melibiose, saccharose, xylose, fructose, and gluconate.
The type strain is MKT110T (=IAM 15107T=KCTC 12372T), which was isolated from the gastrointestinal tract of the mollusk sea slug E. ornata at Miyake Island, Tokyo, Japan.
